paper.title: SKEME: a versatile secure key exchange mechanism for Internet

author.org: IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center Yorktown Heights, NY, USA

paper.venue: Network and Distributed System Security Symposium

keywords.keyword: Internet Security Association and Key Management Protocol

paper.abstract: A secure and versatile key exchange protocol for key management over Internet is presented. SKEME constitutes a compact protocol that supports a variety of realistic scenarios and security models over Internet. It provides clear tradeoffs between security and performance as required by the different scenarios without incurring in unnecessary system complexity. The protocol supports key exchange based on public key, key distribution centers, or manual installation, and provides for fast and secure key refreshment. In addition, SKEME selectively provides perfect forward secrecy, allows for replaceability and negotiation of the underlying cryptographic primitives, and addresses privacy issues as anonymity and repudiatability.
